name: Unresponsive
title: Unresponsive
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This set of values contains codes that may indicate that a patient is unresponsive.),(Data Element Scope: The intent of this data element is to identify patients who are unresponsive. Using the Quality Data model, this element maps to the "Symptom" category.),(Inclusion Criteria: Include levels of consciousness that indicate a patient is unresponsive and unable to participate in assessments.),(Exclusion Criteria: Exclude values that indicate other levels of consciousness.)

concept.display: Unable to express basic needs even with maximal prompting or assistance but is not comatose or unresponsive (for example, speech is nonsensical or unintelligible).
Responds only with reflex motor or autonomic effects or totally unresponsive, flaccid, and areflexic.
Completely limited - Unresponsive (does not flinch, grasp, moan, increase blood pressure, or heart rate) to painful stimuli due to diminished level of consciousness or sedation.

contains.display: Unable to express basic needs even with maximal prompting or assistance but is not comatose or unresponsive (for example, speech is nonsensical or unintelligible).
Responds only with reflex motor or autonomic effects or totally unresponsive, flaccid, and areflexic.
Completely limited - Unresponsive (does not flinch, grasp, moan, increase blood pressure, or heart rate) to painful stimuli due to diminished level of consciousness or sedation.
